pokedex_entries.sun: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokémon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.
pokedex_entries.moon: Despite what its appearance suggests, it cares for others. If it finds vulnerable, weak Pokémon, it protectively brings them into its water bubble.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It usually passes its time in the water. When its belly is full, it stores its subdued prey in the water bubble on its head.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It has a habit of storing things it values in its water bubble. If its Trainer doesn’t watch out, Araquanid will try to put them in its bubble!
pokedex_entries.sword: It launches water bubbles with its legs, drowning prey within the bubbles. This Pokémon can then take its time to savor its meal.
pokedex_entries.shield: It acts as a caretaker for Dewpider, putting them inside its bubble and letting them eat any leftover food.

pokedex_entries.sun: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.
pokedex_entries.moon: This Pokémon has the habit of hugging its companions. Many Trainers have left this world after their spines were squashed by its hug.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It waves its hands wildly in intimidation and warning. Life is over for anyone who doesn’t run away as fast as possible.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It boasts tremendous physical strength. Many people call it the most dangerous Pokémon in the Alola region.
pokedex_entries.sword: Once it accepts you as a friend, it tries to show its affection with a hug. Letting it do that is dangerous—it could easily shatter your bones.
pokedex_entries.shield: The moves it uses to take down its prey would make a martial artist jealous. It tucks subdued prey under its arms to carry them to its nest.

pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It’s apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponents’ surprise to rob them of their vitality.

pokedex_entries.sun: A delectable aroma pours from its body. They are often swallowed whole by Toucannon lured by that wafting deliciousness.
pokedex_entries.moon: Although it’s too sugary for human consumption, Bounsweet’s sweat can be watered down into a juice with just the right amount of sweetness.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Because of its sweet, delicious aroma, bird Pokémon are always after it, but it’s not intelligent enough to care.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It tries to resist being swallowed by a bird Pokémon by spinning the sepals on its head. It’s usually a fruitless attempt.
pokedex_entries.sword: Its body gives off a sweet, fruity scent that is extremely appetizing to bird Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.shield: When under attack, it secretes a sweet and delicious sweat. The scent only calls more enemies to it.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Its sweat is sweet, like syrup made from boiled-down fruit. Because of this, Bounsweet was highly valued in the past, when sweeteners were scarce.
pokedex_entries.violet: A Greedent drawn in by the sweet scent of these Pokémon will tuck the Bounsweet in among the berries in its tail and carry them all away.

pokedex_entries.sun: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, and briskly bombards its enemies.
pokedex_entries.moon: It cares deeply for its companions. When its Trainer is feeling down, it performs a cheery dance to try and help.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It gets excited when it sees a dance it doesn’t know. This hard worker practices diligently until it can learn that dance.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It attacks by smacking its enemies with the exploding water balloons that it creates.
pokedex_entries.sword: As if dancing, it artfully dodges the attacks of its enemies. All the while, it’s busy forming a bunch of balloons to overwhelm its foes.
pokedex_entries.shield: On nights when the sea is calm, Brionne dance with one another to the singing of the Primarina that’s leading them.

pokedex_entries.sun: When it unleashes its psychic power from the protuberance on its head, the grating sound of grinding teeth echoes through the area.
pokedex_entries.moon: It stuns its prey with psychokinesis and then grinds them to mush with its strong teeth. Even Shellder’s shell is no match for it.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It burrows beneath the sand, radiating psychic power from the protuberance on its head. It waits for prey as it surveys the area.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Its skin is thick enough to fend off Mareanie’s spikes. With its robust teeth, Bruxish crunches up the spikes and eats them.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: It grinds its teeth with great force to stimulate its brain. It fires the psychic energy created by this process from the protuberance on its head.
pokedex_entries.violet: When sunlight reflects on the ripples created by a Bruxish grinding its teeth, the water all around sparkles brilliantly.

pokedex_entries.sun: This Ultra Beast appeared from another world. It shows off its body, but whether that display is a boast or a threat remains unclear.
pokedex_entries.moon: A mysterious life-form called an Ultra Beast. Witnesses saw it pulverize a dump truck with a single punch.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.

pokedex_entries.sun: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. Witnesses observed it flying across the sky at high speed.
pokedex_entries.moon: One kind of Ultra Beast. Witnesses have seen it burn down a forest by expelling gas from its two arms.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: One of the dangerous UBs, high energy readings can be detected coming from both of its huge arms.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

pokedex_entries.sun: Its body is capable of storing electricity. On camping trips, people are grateful to have one around.
pokedex_entries.moon: From the food it digests, it generates electricity, and it stores this energy in its electric sac.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It buries itself in fallen leaves and barely moves, munching away on humus. If you accidentally step on one, you’ll get a shock!
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Its stout shell provides excellent defense from attacks. It uses electricity on persistent opponents.
pokedex_entries.sword: While its durable shell protects it from attacks, Charjabug strikes at enemies with jolts of electricity discharged from the tips of its jaws.
pokedex_entries.shield: Its digestive processes convert the leaves it eats into electricity. An electric sac in its belly stores the electricity for later use.

pokedex_entries.sun: It attaches flowers to its highly nutritious vine. This revitalizes the flowers, and they give off an aromatic scent.
pokedex_entries.moon: Baths prepared with the flowers from its vine have a relaxing effect, so this Pokémon is a hit with many people.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It stretches sticky vines out from its head and picks flowers to adorn itself with. When it doesn’t have any flowers, it feels uneasy.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It picks flowers and sticks them to its body with fluids it produces. The aroma that wafts from its petals has a healing effect.
pokedex_entries.sword: Comfey picks flowers with its vine and decorates itself with them. For some reason, flowers won’t wither once they’re attached to a Comfey.
pokedex_entries.shield: These Pokémon smell very nice. All Comfey wear different flowers, so each of these Pokémon has its own individual scent.

pokedex_entries.sun: Motionless as if dead, its body is faintly warm to the touch. In the distant past, it was called the cocoon of the stars.
pokedex_entries.moon: There’s something accumulating around the black core within its hard shell. People think this Pokémon may come from another world.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: The king who ruled Alola in times of antiquity called it the “cocoon of the stars” and built an altar to worship it.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: As it absorbs light, Cosmoem continues to grow. Its golden shell is surprisingly solid.
pokedex_entries.sword: The absorption of starlight fuels this Pokémon’s growth. The shell that encases it is harder than any known material.
pokedex_entries.shield: It sucks in dust from the air at an astounding rate, frantically building up energy within its core as preparation for evolution.

pokedex_entries.sun: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.
pokedex_entries.moon: In ages past, it was called the child of the stars. It’s said to be a Pokémon from another world, but no specific details are known.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn’t seem to care.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Whether or not it’s a Pokémon from this world is a mystery. When it’s in a jam, it warps away to a safe place to hide.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon came from another universe. Its gaseous body is so light that even a gentle breeze can blow it away.
pokedex_entries.shield: Cosmog is very curious but not very cautious, often placing itself in danger. If things start to look dicey, it teleports away.

pokedex_entries.sun: It aimed for the top but got lost and ended up on a snowy mountain. Being forced to endure the cold, this Pokémon evolved and grew fur.
pokedex_entries.moon: It just throws punches indiscriminately. In times of desperation, it can lop off its own pincers and fire them like rockets.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It stores coldness in its pincers and pummels its foes. It can even smash thick walls of ice to bits!
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Before it stops to think, it just starts pummeling. There are records of its turning back avalanches with a flurry of punches.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: The detached pincers of these Pokémon are delicious. Some Trainers bring Lechonk into the mountains just to search for them.
pokedex_entries.violet: Though its punches are powerful, this Pokémon’s movements are sluggish. It blows icy bubbles from its mouth to immobilize its opponents.

pokedex_entries.sun: While guarding its weak points with its pincers, it looks for an opening and unleashes punches. When it loses, it foams at the mouth and faints.
pokedex_entries.moon: It punches so much, its pincers often come off from overuse, but they grow back quickly. What little meat they contain is rich and delicious.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Its hard pincers are well suited to both offense and defense. Fights between two Crabrawler are like boxing matches.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Crabrawler has been known to mistake Exeggutor for a coconut tree and climb it. The enraged Exeggutor shakes it off and stomps it.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon punches trees and eats the berries that drop down, training itself and getting food at the same time.
pokedex_entries.violet: If it loses its pincers, they’ll quickly regrow. The pincers are popular ingredients in paella since their shells produce a tasty soup stock.

pokedex_entries.sun: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. Because it’s able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.
pokedex_entries.moon: Myriads of Cutiefly flutter above the heads of people who have auras resembling those of flowers.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Nectar and pollen are its favorite fare. In fields of flowers, it gets into skirmishes with Butterfree over food.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Cutiefly can pick up the auras of living things. It skillfully reads those auras to predict its foes’ movements and make fools of them.
pokedex_entries.sword: Nectar and pollen are its favorite fare. You can find Cutiefly hovering around Gossifleur, trying to get some of Gossifleur’s pollen.
pokedex_entries.shield: An opponent’s aura can tell Cutiefly what that opponent’s next move will be. Then Cutiefly can glide around the attack and strike back.

pokedex_entries.sun: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.
pokedex_entries.moon: It throws sharp feathers called blade quills at enemies or prey. It seldom misses.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you don’t groom it diligently, it will stop listening to you.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Supremely sensitive to the presence of others, it can detect opponents standing behind it, flinging its sharp feathers to take them out.
pokedex_entries.sword: It throws one knifelike feather after another at its enemies, and each one precisely strikes a weak point. These feathers are known as blade quills.
pokedex_entries.shield: It never slacks when it comes to the task of cleaning its feathers. Thorough preening keeps it looking spiffy and its blade quills nice and sharp.
pokedex_entries.legends:_arceus: Regularly basks in sunlight to gather power—presumably due to the frigid climate. Nonetheless, the edges of the blade quills set into its wings are keen as ever.

pokedex_entries.sun: It fires arrow quills from its wings with such precision, they can pierce a pebble at distances over a hundred yards.
pokedex_entries.moon: Although basically cool and cautious, when it’s caught by surprise, it’s seized by panic.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It nocks its arrow quills and shoots them at opponents. When it simply can’t afford to miss, it tugs the vine on its head to improve its focus.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Decidueye can nock and fire an arrow at an enemy in a tenth of a second, so its battles are decided in the blink of an eye.
pokedex_entries.sword: As if wielding a bow, it launches the arrow quills hidden among the feathers of its wings. Decidueye’s shots never miss.
pokedex_entries.shield: In a tenth of a second, it can nock and fire an arrow quill, piercing an opponent’s weak point before they notice what’s happening.

pokedex_entries.sun: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.
pokedex_entries.moon: When it comes across enemies or potential prey, this Pokémon smashes its water-bubble-covered head into them.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: When two Dewpider meet, they display their water bubbles to each other. Then the one with the smaller bubble gets out of the other’s way.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It can only breathe oxygen that has dissolved in water, so it wears a water bubble on its head when it walks around on land.
pokedex_entries.sword: It forms a water bubble at the rear of its body and then covers its head with it. Meeting another Dewpider means comparing water-bubble sizes.
pokedex_entries.shield: Dewpider normally lives underwater. When it comes onto land in search of food, it takes water with it in the form of a bubble on its head.

pokedex_entries.sun: Swinging its massive anchor, it can KO Wailord in a single blow. What appears to be green seaweed is actually its body.
pokedex_entries.moon: The soul of seaweed adrift in the waves became reborn as this Pokémon. It maintains itself with new infusions of seabed detritus and seaweed.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It wraps its prey in green seaweed and sucks away their vitality. It only likes to go after big prey like Wailord.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Its chain-like green seaweed can stretch outward for hundreds of yards. For some reason, it gets along well with Skrelp.
pokedex_entries.sword: After a piece of seaweed merged with debris from a sunken ship, it was reborn as this ghost Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.shield: After lowering its anchor, it waits for its prey. It catches large Wailord and drains their life-force.

pokedex_entries.sun: It has a compassionate personality, but if it is angered, it completely destroys its surroundings with its intense breath.
pokedex_entries.moon: This Pokémon is friendly to people and loves children most of all. It comes from deep in the mountains to play with children it likes in town.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: If a child it has made friends with is bullied, Drampa will find the bully’s house and burn it to the ground.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It appears in towns and plays with the children. Drampa will protect kids when they’re in danger, so their moms don’t have to worry.
pokedex_entries.sword: The mountains it calls home are nearly two miles in height. On rare occasions, it descends to play with the children living in the towns below.
pokedex_entries.shield: Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémon—up until it’s angered. When that happens, it stirs up a gale and flattens everything around.

pokedex_entries.sun: During the day, it sleeps and soaks up light. When night falls, it walks around looking for a safer place to sleep.
pokedex_entries.moon: They give off a sweet and refreshing scent. Cutiefly often gather near the tall grass where Fomantis are hiding.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: When the sun rises, Fomantis spreads its four leaves and bathes in the sunlight. The tip of its head has a pleasant aroma.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It loves the sunshine. When it basks in the sunlight regularly, it grows up with vivid coloration.
pokedex_entries.sword: When bathed in sunlight, this Pokémon emits a pleasantly sweet scent, which causes bug Pokémon to gather around it.
pokedex_entries.shield: During the day, Fomantis basks in sunlight and sleeps peacefully. It wakes and moves around at night.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Fomantis hates having its naps interrupted. It fires off beams using energy it gathers by bathing in the sun.
pokedex_entries.violet: Many Trainers give their Fomantis their own flowerpots so they can sunbathe in peace and quiet.

pokedex_entries.sun: With a flashing slash of its giant sharp claws, it cleaves seawater—or even air—right in two.
pokedex_entries.moon: It battles skillfully with its six arms, but spends most of its time peacefully meditating in caves deep beneath the sea.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: The shell covering its body is as hard as diamond. This Pokémon will do anything it takes to win.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Its claws, which it can extend and retract at will, are its greatest weapons. Golisopod is sometimes accompanied by Wimpod.
pokedex_entries.sword: It will do anything to win, taking advantage of every opening and finishing opponents off with the small claws on its front legs.
pokedex_entries.shield: They live in sunken ships or in holes in the seabed. When Golisopod and Grapploct battle, the loser becomes the winner’s meal.

pokedex_entries.sun: Its strong jaw enables it to scrape trees and slurp out the sap. It normally lives underground.
pokedex_entries.moon: They often gather near places frequented by electric Pokémon in order to avoid being attacked by bird Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: If you find its nest, you shouldn’t stick your hand inside. You’ll get bitten by an irritated Grubbin.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It spits a sticky thread to stop opponents in their tracks, and then it grabs them in its sharp, sturdy mandibles to take them down.
pokedex_entries.sword: Its natural enemies, like Rookidee, may flee rather than risk getting caught in its large mandibles that can snap thick tree branches.
pokedex_entries.shield: It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest floor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.

pokedex_entries.sun: When it finds a trace of its prey, it patiently stakes out the location...but it’s always snoozing by nightfall.
pokedex_entries.moon: It adores having Rattata and Raticate for dinner, but as it’s diurnal, it never encounters them. This Pokémon boasts incredible patience.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Although it wasn’t originally found in Alola, this Pokémon was brought over a long time ago when there was a huge Rattata outbreak.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Patient by nature, this Pokémon loses control of itself and pounces when it spots its favorite meal—Rattata!
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Once it finds signs of prey, it will patiently stake out the location, waiting until the sun goes down.
pokedex_entries.violet: Gumshoos specializes in relentlessly tracking down prey. The simple-minded Skwovet doesn’t seem to provide Gumshoos enough challenge.

pokedex_entries.sun: It has gobbled mountains and swallowed whole buildings, according to reports. It’s one of the Ultra Beasts.
pokedex_entries.moon: A dangerous Ultra Beast, it appears to be eating constantly, but for some reason its droppings have never been found.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be constantly hungry—it is certainly always devouring something.

pokedex_entries.sun: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches tear its opponents to shreds.
pokedex_entries.moon: It sheds and regrows its scales on a continuous basis. The scales become harder and sharper each time they’re regrown.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It makes noise by clanging its scales together. When the rhythm has reached its peak, Hakamo-o attacks.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: The scales it sheds can be molded and processed to make pots and pans. They conduct heat well, so they’re a popular item.
pokedex_entries.sword: The scaleless, scarred parts of its body are signs of its strength. It shows them off to defeated opponents.
pokedex_entries.shield: Before attacking its enemies, it clashes its scales together and roars. Its sharp claws shred the opposition.

pokedex_entries.sun: This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. If it’s not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainer’s orders with complete nonchalance.
pokedex_entries.moon: After hurling ferocious punches and flinging furious kicks, it finishes opponents off by spewing fire from around its navel.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Although it’s rough mannered and egotistical, it finds beating down unworthy opponents boring. It gets motivated for stronger opponents.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: When its fighting spirit is set alight, the flames around its waist become especially intense.
pokedex_entries.sword: It excels at violent, no-holds-barred battles. The temperature of the flames that issue from its navel exceeds 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.shield: Incineroar’s rough and aggressive behavior is its most notable trait, but the way it helps out small Pokémon shows that it has a kind side as well.

pokedex_entries.sun: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o lives.
pokedex_entries.moon: They live in mountains where no trace of humans can be detected. Jangmo-o grow little by little as they battle one another.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It smacks the scales on its head against rocks or against the ground to frighten its opponents. It can also contact its friends with these noises.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It will never show an enemy its back in battle. Ancient warriors liked Jangmo-o for its valiant disposition and made it one of their own.
pokedex_entries.sword: They learn to fight by smashing their head scales together. The dueling strengthens both their skills and their spirits.
pokedex_entries.shield: Jangmo-o strikes its scales to communicate with others of its kind. Its scales are actually fur that’s become as hard as metal.

pokedex_entries.sun: This Ultra Beast came from the Ultra Wormhole. It seems not to attack enemies on its own, but its sharp body is a dangerous weapon in itself.
pokedex_entries.moon: One of the Ultra Beast life-forms, it was observed cutting down a gigantic steel tower with one stroke of its blade.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: This Ultra Beast’s body, which is as thin as paper, is like a sharpened sword.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

pokedex_entries.sun: It is born asleep, and it dies asleep. All its movements are apparently no more than the results of it tossing and turning in its dreams.
pokedex_entries.moon: The log it holds was given to it by its parents at birth. It has also been known to cling to the arm of a friendly Trainer.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It stays asleep from the moment it’s born. When it falls into a deep sleep, it stops moving altogether.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It remains asleep from birth to death as a result of the sedative properties of the leaves that form its diet.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Komala spends its entire life sleeping. It feeds on leaves that contain a potent poison only Komala can break down.
pokedex_entries.violet: A potent anesthetic can be made by diluting Komala’s drool. This anesthetic was used for surgeries in the past.

pokedex_entries.sun: When it spots enemies, it threatens them by jingling the scales on its tail. Weak opponents will crack and flee in panic.
pokedex_entries.moon: Its rigid scales function as offense and defense. In the past, its scales were processed and used to make weapons and other commodities.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: When it howls after finishing off its prey, the metallic sounds of its celebrating comrades can be heard from all around.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It battles valiantly with its fists, which are armored in steel scales. Kommo-o specializes in uppercuts.
pokedex_entries.sword: It clatters its tail scales to unnerve opponents. This Pokémon will battle only those who stand steadfast in the face of this display.
pokedex_entries.shield: Certain ruins have paintings of ancient warriors wearing armor made of Kommo-o scales.

pokedex_entries.sun: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.
pokedex_entries.moon: It doesn’t allow its emotions to be easily seen. Earning its trust takes time. It prefers solitude.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won’t open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Its coat regrows twice a year. When the time comes, Litten sets its own body on fire and burns away the old fur.
pokedex_entries.sword: It spends even the smallest amount of downtime grooming its fur with its tongue. Loose fur gathers in its stomach and serves as fuel for fiery moves.
pokedex_entries.shield: Trying to pet Litten before it trusts you will result in a nasty scratch from its sharp claws. Be careful.

pokedex_entries.sun: It is said to be a female evolution of Cosmog. When its third eye activates, away it flies to another world.
pokedex_entries.moon: Said to live in another world, this Pokémon devours light, drawing the moonless dark veil of night over the brightness of day.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Records of it exist in writings from long, long ago, where it was known by the name “the beast that calls the moon.”
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It sometimes summons unknown powers and life-forms here to this world from holes that lead to other worlds.
pokedex_entries.sword: Known as the Beast That Calls the Moon, this Pokémon lives by taking in any and all light and converting it into its own energy.
pokedex_entries.shield: It steals the light from its surroundings and then becomes the full moon, showering its own light across the night sky.

pokedex_entries.sun: It requires a lot of effort to maintain Lurantis’s vivid coloring, but some collectors enjoy this work and treat it as their hobby.
pokedex_entries.moon: It fires beams from its sickle-shaped petals. These beams are powerful enough to cleave through thick metal plates.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: For self-protection, it pretends to be a bug Pokémon. Both of its arms bear keen-edged petals.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: As it slashes into its enemies, it looks like it’s dancing. Its elegant appearance has led some to call it the most glamorous Grass Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon resembles a beautiful flower. A properly raised Lurantis will have gorgeous, brilliant colors.
pokedex_entries.shield: The petals on this Pokémon’s arms are thin and super sharp, and they can fire laser beams if Lurantis gathers light first.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: By masquerading as a bug Pokémon, it lowers the guard of actual bug Pokémon lured in by a scent of sweet flowers. Its sickles bring them down.
pokedex_entries.violet: A lot of time and effort is required to maintain the vivid colors of its petals. This Pokémon puts its Trainer’s attentiveness to the test.

pokedex_entries.sun: Its quick movements confuse its enemies. Well equipped with claws and fangs, it also uses the sharp rocks in its mane as weapons.
pokedex_entries.moon: When properly raised from a young age, it will become a trustworthy partner that will absolutely never betray its Trainer.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: The sharp rocks in its mane can cut like knives. Lycanroc wears its prey down by degrees before finishing them off.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: The rocks in its mane are sharper than a knife. Fragments that break off are treasured as good luck charms.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Lycanroc is calm and cautious. The rocks jutting from its mane are razor sharp.
pokedex_entries.shield: With swift movements, this Pokémon gradually backs its prey into a corner. Lycanroc’s fangs are always aimed toward opponents’ weak spots.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Lycanroc attacks its prey with its sharp claws and fangs. It loyally obeys the instructions of a Trainer it trusts.
pokedex_entries.violet: It has a calm and collected demeanor. It swiftly closes in on its prey, then slices them with the rocks in its mane.

pokedex_entries.sun: This artificial Pokémon, constructed more than 500 years ago, can understand human speech but cannot itself speak.
pokedex_entries.moon: Its mechanized body is merely a vessel. Its true self is its Soul-Heart, an artificial soul.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It synchronizes its consciousness with others to understand their feelings. This faculty makes it useful for taking care of people.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.

pokedex_entries.sun: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.
pokedex_entries.moon: It’s found crawling on beaches and seafloors. The coral that grows on Corsola’s head is as good as a five-star banquet to this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: They eat Corsola branches, so Mareanie are hated by craftsmen who work with Corsola branches that have naturally fallen off.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Aside from its head, its body parts regenerate quickly if they’re cut off. After a good night’s sleep, Mareanie is back to normal.
pokedex_entries.sword: The first symptom of its sting is numbness. The next is an itching sensation so intense that it’s impossible to resist the urge to claw at your skin.
pokedex_entries.shield: Unlike their Alolan counterparts, the Mareanie of the Galar region have not yet figured out that the branches of Corsola are delicious.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon wanders the seaside looking for food. It often gets electric shocks from broken Pincurchin spines that it tries to eat.
pokedex_entries.violet: It has excellent regenerative capabilities. Legs that a Mareanie has lost have a very bitter, astringent flavor—they’re not suitable as food.

pokedex_entries.sun: Able to conceal itself in shadows, it never appears before humans, so its very existence was the stuff of myth.
pokedex_entries.moon: It lurks in the shadows of others, copying their movements and powers. This Pokémon is craven and cowering.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It slips into the shadows of others and mimics their powers and movements. As it improves, it becomes stronger than those it’s imitating.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It sinks into the shadows of people and Pokémon, where it can understand their feelings and copy their capabilities.
pokedex_entries.sword: By slipping into the shadow of a martial arts master and copying their movements, this Pokémon learned the ultimate techniques.
pokedex_entries.shield: This Pokémon can conceal itself in any shadow, so it went undiscovered for a long time.

pokedex_entries.let's_go_pikachulet's_go_eevee: Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron from nothing, for some reason it has come back to life after 3,000 years.
pokedex_entries.sword: At the end of its life-span, Melmetal will rust and fall apart. The small shards left behind will eventually be reborn as Meltan.
pokedex_entries.shield: Centrifugal force is behind the punches of Melmetal’s heavy hex-nut arms. Melmetal is said to deliver the strongest punches of all Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.let's_go_pikachulet's_go_eevee: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.
pokedex_entries.sword: It dissolves and eats metal. Circulating liquid metal within its body is how it generates energy.
pokedex_entries.shield: They live as a group, but when the time comes, one strong Meltan will absorb all the others and evolve.

pokedex_entries.sun: After going to all the effort of disguising itself, its neck was broken. Whatever is inside is probably unharmed, but it’s still feeling sad.
pokedex_entries.moon: If its neck is broken or its rag torn during an attack, it works through the night to patch it.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It stands in front of a mirror, trying to fix its broken neck as if its life depended on it. It has a hard time getting it right, so it’s crying inside.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Sad that its true identity may be exposed, Mimikyu will mercilessly seek revenge on any opponent that breaks its neck.
pokedex_entries.sword: There will be no forgiveness for any who reveal that it was pretending to be Pikachu. It will bring the culprit down, even at the cost of its own life.
pokedex_entries.shield: Its disguise made from an old rag allowed it to avoid an attack, but the impact broke the neck of the disguise. Now everyone knows it’s a Mimikyu.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Even as it struggles beneath the cloth to repair the broken neck of its disguise, Mimikyu keeps up its impersonation of Pikachu.
pokedex_entries.violet: It has taken damage and can no longer hold the head of its cloth disguise upright. For as long as it lives, Mimikyu will never forget its attacker.

pokedex_entries.sun: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.
pokedex_entries.moon: Strong impacts can knock it out of its shell. This Pokémon was born from mutated nanoparticles.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It lives in the ozone layer, where it becomes food for stronger Pokémon. When it tries to run away, it falls to the ground.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.

pokedex_entries.sun: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.
pokedex_entries.moon: As it drowses the day away, it nourishes itself by sucking from tree roots. It wakens at the fall of night, wandering off in search of a new tree.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It scatters its shining spores around itself. Even though they’re dangerous, nighttime tours of forests where Morelull live are popular.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It likes damp dark places. When night falls, the spores filling the caps of its mushrooms glow.
pokedex_entries.sword: Pokémon living in the forest eat the delicious caps on Morelull’s head. The caps regrow overnight.
pokedex_entries.shield: Morelull live in forests that stay dark even during the day. They scatter flickering spores that put enemies to sleep.

pokedex_entries.sun: The mud stuck to Mudbray’s hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.
pokedex_entries.moon: It has a stubborn, individualistic disposition. Eating dirt, making mud, and playing in the mire all form part of its daily routine.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It loves playing in the mud. If it isn’t showered with mud on a daily basis, it gets stressed out and stops listening to its Trainer.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Possessing mighty power, Mudbray can be loaded with 50 times its own body weight and will be totally fine.
pokedex_entries.sword: Loads weighing up to 50 times as much as its own body weight pose no issue for this Pokémon. It’s skilled at making use of mud.
pokedex_entries.shield: It eats dirt to create mud and smears this mud all over its feet, giving them the grip needed to walk on rough terrain without slipping.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon covers itself in mud that it has regurgitated. The mud won’t dry out even if it’s exposed to the sun for a long time.
pokedex_entries.violet: Though a slow walker, Mudbray is plenty strong. Its pace doesn’t change even when it’s loaded with 50 times its own body weight.

pokedex_entries.sun: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.
pokedex_entries.moon: Its heavy, mud-covered kicks are its best means of attack, and it can reduce large trucks to scrap without breaking a sweat.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It remains calm and unmoving no matter the situation. It mixes dirt with the saliva in its mouth to make a special kind of mud.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It can trudge mountain roads without rest for three days and three nights, all the while dragging a 10-ton load.
pokedex_entries.sword: Mud that hardens around a Mudsdale’s legs sets harder than stone. It’s so hard that it allows this Pokémon to scrap a truck with a single kick.
pokedex_entries.shield: Mudsdale has so much stamina that it could carry over 10 tons across the Galar region without rest or sleep.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon has been treasured not just for its physical labor but also because it produces high-quality mud used for making pottery.
pokedex_entries.violet: Its legs are fortified with mud and harder than stone, and they can reduce a large truck to scrap with one kick.

pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid inside its body. It is one of the organisms known as UBs.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.

pokedex_entries.sun: Reminiscent of the Ultra Beasts, this life-form, apparently asleep underground, is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.
pokedex_entries.moon: Light is apparently the source of its energy. It has an extraordinarily vicious disposition and is constantly firing off laser beams.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It looks somehow pained as it rages around in search of light, which serves as its energy. It’s apparently from another world.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Light is the source of its energy. If it isn’t devouring light, impurities build up in it and on it, and Necrozma darkens and stops moving.
pokedex_entries.sword: It survives by absorbing light. After a long time spent slumbering underground, impurities accumulated within it, causing its body to darken.
pokedex_entries.shield: It needs light to survive, and it goes on a rampage seeking it out. Its laser beams will cut anything to pieces.

pokedex_entries.sun: One of several mysterious Ultra Beasts. People on the street report observing those infested by it suddenly becoming violent.
pokedex_entries.moon: One of the Ultra Beasts. It’s unclear whether or not this Pokémon is sentient, but sometimes it can be observed behaving like a young girl.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: A life-form from another world, it was dubbed a UB and is thought to produce a strong neurotoxin.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It appeared in this world from an Ultra Wormhole. Nihilego appears to be a parasite that lives by feeding on people and Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.sun: Known for its extreme intelligence, this Pokémon will look down on inexperienced Trainers, so it’s best suited to veteran Trainers.
pokedex_entries.moon: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It normally spends its time meditating in the treetops. It throws Poké Balls and gives other Pokémon orders as it pleases.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Oranguru don’t get along with each other, so they’re always engaging in battles of wits to decide which one is superior.
pokedex_entries.sword: With waves of its fan—made from leaves and its own fur—Oranguru skillfully gives instructions to other Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.shield: It knows the forest inside and out. If it comes across a wounded Pokémon, Oranguru will gather medicinal herbs to treat it.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: People used to mistake Oranguru for a human when they saw it issue command after command to the other Pokémon of the forest.
pokedex_entries.violet: This Pokémon lives quietly in the depths of the forest. The purple, cape-like fur gets longer and longer as Oranguru ages.

pokedex_entries.sun: It beats its wings together to create fire. As it moves in the steps of its beautiful dance, it bathes opponents in intense flames.
pokedex_entries.moon: This Oricorio has sipped red nectar. Its passionate dance moves cause its enemies to combust in both body and mind.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It wins the hearts of its enemies with its passionate dancing and then uses the opening it creates to burn them up with blazing flames.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon becomes fiercely angry.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon is incredibly popular, possibly because its passionate dancing is a great match with the temperament of Paldean people.
pokedex_entries.violet: This form of Oricorio has sipped red nectar. It whips up blazing flames as it moves to the steps of its passionate dance.

pokedex_entries.sun: Possessed people controlled by this Pokémon transformed its sand mound into a castle. As it evolved, its power to curse grew ever stronger.
pokedex_entries.moon: Buried beneath the castle are masses of dried-up bones from those whose vitality it has drained.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Each of its grains of sand has its own will. Palossand eats small Pokémon and siphons away their vital essence while they’re still alive.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Once it has whipped up a sandstorm to halt its opponents in their tracks, this terrifying Pokémon snatches away their vitality.
pokedex_entries.sword: Palossand is known as the Beach Nightmare. It pulls its prey down into the sand by controlling the sand itself, and then it sucks out their souls.
pokedex_entries.shield: This Pokémon lives on beaches, but it hates water. Palossand can’t maintain its castle-like shape if it gets drenched by a heavy rain.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: The terrifying Palossand drags smaller Pokémon into its sandy body. Once its victims are trapped, it drains them of their vitality whenever it pleases.
pokedex_entries.violet: From the hollows in its arms, it fires the bones of its victims, which are all dried up after being drained of their vitality.

pokedex_entries.sun: They form groups of roughly 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkable—they will never let down a comrade.
pokedex_entries.moon: They battle with hard berries for weapons. Their techniques are passed from the boss to the group, generation upon generation.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: They use their saliva to stick leaves to their shoulders. You can tell what troop they belong to from the position of the leaves.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Berries are its weapons as well as the staple of its diet. The one that can throw a berry the farthest is the boss of the troop.
pokedex_entries.sword: Displaying amazing teamwork, they follow the orders of their boss as they all help out in the search for their favorite berries.
pokedex_entries.shield: Passimian live in groups of about 20, with each member performing an assigned role. Through cooperation, the group survives.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon battles by throwing hard berries. It won’t obey a Trainer who throws Poké Balls without skill.
pokedex_entries.violet: The boss chooses 10 members of the group to go out hunting. The hunting party will evenly split the food they find with the rest of the group.

pokedex_entries.sun: One of the dangerous Ultra Beasts, it has been spotted running across the land at terrific speeds.
pokedex_entries.moon: One of the Ultra Beasts. It refuses to touch anything, perhaps because it senses some uncleanness in this world.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: A life-form that lives in another world, its body is thin and supple, but it also possesses great power.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

pokedex_entries.sun: It can peck at a rate of 16 times a second to drill holes in trees. It uses the holes for food storage and for nesting.
pokedex_entries.moon: This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for the attacks it fires off from its mouth.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It pecks at trees with its hard beak. You can get some idea of its mood or condition from the rhythm of its pecking.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!

pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.

pokedex_entries.sun: This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It’s famous for being a hard worker.
pokedex_entries.moon: This Pokémon can control water bubbles. It practices diligently so it can learn to make big bubbles.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: The balloons it inflates with its nose grow larger and larger as it practices day by day.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Popplio gets on top of its bouncy water balloons to jump higher. It’s quite the acrobatic fighter!
pokedex_entries.sword: It creates special bouncy balloons to send at its opponents. When the balloons pop, the sheer force of their bursting is what deals damage.
pokedex_entries.shield: If Popplio want to create big, powerful balloons, they must be persistent. It takes daily practice for these Pokémon to develop their skills.

pokedex_entries.sun: It controls its water balloons with song. The melody is learned from others of its kind and is passed down from one generation to the next.
pokedex_entries.moon: Its singing voice is its chief weapon in battle. This Pokémon’s Trainer must prioritize the daily maintenance of its throat at all costs.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: To Primarina, every battle is a stage. It takes down its prey with beautiful singing and dancing.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Also known as a songstress, it has a fantastical look on moonlit nights when it leads its colony in song.
pokedex_entries.sword: With its mouth, it makes sonic waves that sound like beautiful singing. It uses the sonic waves to control its water balloons.
pokedex_entries.shield: For Primarina, every battle’s a stage. Its singing and the dancing of its balloons will mesmerize the audience.

pokedex_entries.sun: It lives in shallow seas, such as areas near a beach. It can eject its internal organs, which it uses to engulf its prey or battle enemies.
pokedex_entries.moon: These Pokémon line the beaches. The sticky mucous that covers their bodies can be used to soothe sunburned skin. How convenient!
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: The tradition known as Pyukumuku chucking started from the custom of throwing Pyukumuku back into the sea after they wash onshore.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Its entire body is covered in its own slime. If you accidentally step on one, you’ll slip, and it will get mad and smack you!
pokedex_entries.sword: It lives in warm, shallow waters. If it encounters a foe, it will spit out its internal organs as a means to punch them.
pokedex_entries.shield: It’s covered in a slime that keeps its skin moist, allowing it to stay on land for days without drying up.

pokedex_entries.sun: It rolls up pollen into puffs. It makes many different varieties, some used as food and others used in battle.
pokedex_entries.moon: Some of Ribombee’s pollen puffs are highly nutritious. They are sometimes sold as supplements.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Rain makes pollen damp, so Ribombee hates rain. When it sees ominous clouds, it finds a hollow in a tree, where it waits stock-still.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It can predict the weather from moisture levels and wind direction. Ribombee only reveals itself when there are a few clear days in a row.
pokedex_entries.sword: It makes pollen puffs from pollen and nectar. The puffs’ effects depend on the type of ingredients and how much of each one is used.
pokedex_entries.shield: Ribombee absolutely hate getting wet or rained on. In the cloudy Galar region, they are very seldom seen.

pokedex_entries.sun: It’s considered to be a good Pokémon for beginners because of its friendliness, but its disposition grows rougher as it grows up.
pokedex_entries.moon: This Pokémon has lived with people since times long ago. It can sense when its Trainer is in the dumps and will stick close by its Trainer’s side.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: As they develop, their disposition grows more violent and aggressive. Many Trainers find them too much to handle and abandon them.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: When it rubs the rocks on its neck against you, that’s proof of its love for you. However, the rocks are sharp, so the gesture is quite painful!
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon can bond very strongly with its Trainer, but it also has a habit of biting. Raising a Rockruff for a long time can be challenging.
pokedex_entries.shield: This Pokémon intimidates opponents by striking the ground with the rocks on its neck. The moment an opponent flinches, Rockruff attacks.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon is very friendly when it’s young. Its disposition becomes vicious once it matures, but it never forgets the kindness of its master.
pokedex_entries.violet: This Pokémon travels in a pack with others until it grows up. When its mood turns sour, it starts striking the ground with the rocks on its neck.

pokedex_entries.sun: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.
pokedex_entries.moon: Silently it glides, drawing near its targets. Before they even notice it, it begins to pelt them with vicious kicks.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has been known to use its Trainer’s pocket or bag as a nest.
pokedex_entries.sword: At a distance, it launches its sharp feathers while flying about. If the enemy gets too close, Rowlet switches tactics and delivers vicious kicks.
pokedex_entries.shield: During the day, it builds up energy via photosynthesis. At night, it flies silently through the sky, on the prowl for prey.
pokedex_entries.legends:_arceus: Flies noiselessly on delicate wings. It has mastered the art of deftly launching dagger-sharp feathers from those same wings.

pokedex_entries.sun: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.
pokedex_entries.moon: Volcanoes or dry, craggy places are its home. It emanates a sweet-smelling poisonous gas that attracts bug Pokémon, then attacks them.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: The males will do whatever the females tell them. They give the females most of their food. Due to malnutrition, the males can’t evolve.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It weakens opponents and sends them reeling with its poisonous gas. Salandit doesn’t deal well with Spinda, since it’s always reeling.
pokedex_entries.sword: Its venom sacs produce a fluid that this Pokémon then heats up with the flame in its tail. This process creates Salandit’s poisonous gas.
pokedex_entries.shield: This sneaky Pokémon will slink behind its prey and immobilize it with poisonous gas before the prey even realizes Salandit is there.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: It taunts its prey and lures them into narrow, rocky areas where it then sprays them with toxic gas to make them dizzy and take them down.
pokedex_entries.violet: Only female Salandit can produce gas laden with pheromones. Males entranced by this gas will do whatever the females tell them.

pokedex_entries.sun: For some reason, only females have been found. It creates a reverse harem of male Salandit that it lives with.
pokedex_entries.moon: Filled with pheromones, its poisonous gas can be diluted to use in the production of luscious perfumes.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Salazzle lives deep in caves and forces the Salandit it has attracted with its pheromones to serve it.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It punishes Salandit that couldn’t bring it food with a fierce slap of its flame-spewing palm.
pokedex_entries.sword: Only female Salazzle exist. They emit a gas laden with pheromones to captivate male Salandit.
pokedex_entries.shield: The winner of competitions between Salazzle is decided by which one has the most male Salandit with it.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Salazzle makes its opponents light-headed with poisonous gas, then captivates them with alluring movements to turn them into loyal servants.
pokedex_entries.violet: When two Salazzle meet, they will use their pheromone gas to fight over the males in each other’s group.

pokedex_entries.sun: Born from a sand mound playfully built by a child, this Pokémon embodies the grudges of the departed.
pokedex_entries.moon: It takes control of anyone who puts a hand in its mouth. And so it adds to the accumulation of its sand-mound body.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It likes the shovel on its head, so Sandygast will get serious and fight any children who come to take it back.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: If you build sand mounds when you’re playing, destroy them before you go home, or they may get possessed and become Sandygast.
pokedex_entries.sword: Grudges of the dead have possessed a mound of sand and become a Pokémon. Sandygast is fond of the shovel on its head.
pokedex_entries.shield: Sandygast mainly inhabits beaches. It takes control of anyone who puts their hand into its mouth, forcing them to make its body bigger.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: If it loses its shovel, it will stick something else—like a branch—in its head to make do until it finds another shovel.
pokedex_entries.violet: It flings sand into the eyes of its prey and tries to close in on them while they’re blinded, but since Sandygast is so slow, the prey tends to escape.

pokedex_entries.sun: Forests where Shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. People confused by its strange lights can never find their way home again.
pokedex_entries.moon: It emits flickering spores that cause drowsiness. When its prey succumb to sleep, this Pokémon feeds on them by sucking in their energy.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It puts its prey to sleep and siphons off their vitality through the tip of its arms. If one of its kind is weakened, it helps by sending it vitality.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: When it starts fighting for territory with Parasect, the entire area gets completely coated in spores!
pokedex_entries.sword: Its flickering spores lure in prey and put them to sleep. Once this Pokémon has its prey snoozing, it drains their vitality with its fingertips.
pokedex_entries.shield: If you see a light deep in a forest at night, don’t go near. Shiinotic will make you fall fast asleep.

pokedex_entries.sun: Its trust in its partner is what awakens it. This Pokémon is capable of changing its type, a flexibility that is well displayed in battle.
pokedex_entries.moon: Although its name was Type: Null at first, the boy who evolved it into this form gave it the name by which it is now known.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: This is its form once it has awakened and evolved. Freed from its heavy mask, its speed is greatly increased.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Through the bond it formed with its Trainer, its will was strengthened, and it was able to destroy its control mask.
pokedex_entries.sword: A solid bond of trust between this Pokémon and its Trainer awakened the strength hidden within Silvally. It can change its type at will.
pokedex_entries.shield: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

pokedex_entries.sun: It is said to live in another world. The intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.
pokedex_entries.moon: This Pokémon is said to be a male evolution of Cosmog. At the activation of its third eye, it departs for another world.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Sometimes the result of its opening an Ultra Wormhole is that energy and life-forms from other worlds are called here to this world.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: In writings from the distant past, it’s called by the name “the beast that devours the sun.”
pokedex_entries.sword: When light radiates from its body, this Pokémon could almost appear to be the sun. It will dispel any darkness and light up the world.
pokedex_entries.shield: Solgaleo was once known as the Beast That Devours the Sun. Energy in the form of light radiates boundlessly from it.

pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute’s true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.

pokedex_entries.sun: The sepals on its head developed to protect its body. These are quite hard, so even if pecked by bird Pokémon, this Pokémon is totally fine.
pokedex_entries.moon: This Pokémon is always bouncing around energetically. Other Pokémon are attracted by its lively appearance and pleasant aroma.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It’s protected by its hard sepals, so it plays with bird Pokémon without worry. They peck it relentlessly, but it doesn’t care.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It bounces around, swinging the sepals on its head with abandon. They’re quite painful when they smack you!
pokedex_entries.sword: As it twirls like a dancer, a sweet smell spreads out around it. Anyone who inhales the scent will feel a surge of happiness.
pokedex_entries.shield: Any Corvisquire that pecks at this Pokémon will be greeted with a smack from its sepals followed by a sharp kick.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Steenee spreads a sweet scent that makes others feel invigorated. This same scent is popular for antiperspirants.
pokedex_entries.violet: Steenee bounces energetically through forests. If the rind that peels off its body is pulverized, it can be used to treat stomach pains.

pokedex_entries.sun: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.
pokedex_entries.moon: A touch from anyone except a known friend sends it into a surging frenzy. It’s an incredibly dangerous Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It boasts power enough to split large trees in half. The organ on its rear releases an odor that it uses to communicate with others of its kind.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Stufful hates to be hugged or touched in any way. It will squirm, thrash, and resist with amazing power.
pokedex_entries.sword: Its fluffy fur is a delight to pet, but carelessly reaching out to touch this Pokémon could result in painful retaliation.
pokedex_entries.shield: The way it protects itself by flailing its arms may be an adorable sight, but stay well away. This is flailing that can snap thick tree trunks.

pokedex_entries.sun: It pulls large trees up by the roots and swings them around. It causes vegetation to grow, and then it absorbs energy from the growth.
pokedex_entries.moon: The guardian deity of Ula’ula is a lazy Pokémon. It commands plants to immobilize its foes and then deals them a savage blow with its horns.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Although it’s called a guardian deity, it’s violent enough to crush anyone it sees as an enemy.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts. This guardian deity of Ula’ula controls plants.

pokedex_entries.sun: The dense fog it creates brings the downfall and destruction of its confused enemies. Ocean currents are the source of its energy.
pokedex_entries.moon: The guardian deity of Poni, it can control water. People say it can create pure water that will wash away any uncleanness.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: This guardian deity of Poni Island manipulates water. Because it lives deep within a thick fog, it came to be both feared and revered.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Although it’s called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.

pokedex_entries.sun: This guardian deity of Melemele is brimming with curiosity. It summons thunderclouds and stores their lightning inside its body.
pokedex_entries.moon: It confuses its enemies by flying too quickly for the eye to follow. It has a hair-trigger temper but forgets what made it angry an instant later.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Although it’s called a guardian deity, if a person or Pokémon puts it in a bad mood, it will become a malevolent deity and attack.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: The lightning-wielding guardian deity of Melemele, Tapu Koko is brimming with curiosity and appears before people from time to time.

pokedex_entries.sun: This guardian deity of Akala is guilelessly cruel. The fragrant aroma of flowers is the source of its energy.
pokedex_entries.moon: As it flutters about, it scatters its strangely glowing scales. Touching them is said to restore good health on the spot.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It heals the wounds of people and Pokémon by sprinkling them with its sparkling scales. This guardian deity is worshiped on Akala.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.

pokedex_entries.sun: The spiny fur on its back is normally at rest. When this Pokémon becomes agitated, its fur stands on end and stabs into its attackers.
pokedex_entries.moon: The long hairs on its back act as lightning rods. The bolts of lightning it attracts are stored as energy in its electric sac.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: When it’s surprised or agitated, the 14 fur spikes on its back will stand up involuntarily.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Its capacity to produce electricity is somewhat limited, so it gets charged up by letting lightning strike it!
pokedex_entries.sword: With the long hairs on its back, this Pokémon takes in electricity from other electric Pokémon. It stores what it absorbs in an electric sac.
pokedex_entries.shield: When it’s in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.

pokedex_entries.sun: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire.
pokedex_entries.moon: It boasts powerful front legs. With a single punch, it can bend an iron bar right over.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It can act spoiled if it grows close to its Trainer. A powerful Pokémon, its sharp claws can leave its Trainer’s whole body covered in scratches.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: When its mane is standing on end, you can tell it’s feeling good. When it isn’t feeling well, its fur will lie down flat.
pokedex_entries.sword: In the midst of battle, the fire pouch on Torracat’s neck rings like a bell and produces stronger flames than usual.
pokedex_entries.shield: When facing a powerful enemy, Torracat’s fighting spirit gets pumped up, and its fire bell blazes hotter.

pokedex_entries.sun: When it battles, its beak heats up. The temperature can easily exceed 212 degrees Fahrenheit, causing severe burns when it hits.
pokedex_entries.moon: Within its beak, its internal gas ignites, explosively launching seeds with enough power to pulverize boulders.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: They smack beaks with others of their kind to communicate. The strength and number of hits tell each other how they feel.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.

pokedex_entries.sun: Toxapex crawls along the ocean floor on its 12 legs. It leaves a trail of Corsola bits scattered in its wake.
pokedex_entries.moon: Those attacked by Toxapex’s poison will suffer intense pain for three days and three nights. Post-recovery, there will be some aftereffects.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: To attack, this Pokémon sends toxic spikes flying at its enemies. Ones that come close get mown down by the claws on its feet.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: With its 12 legs, it creates a dome to shelter within. The flow of the tides doesn’t affect Toxapex in there, so it’s very comfortable.
pokedex_entries.sword: To survive in the cold waters of Galar, this Pokémon forms a dome with its legs, enclosing its body so it can capture its own body heat.
pokedex_entries.shield: Within the poison sac in its body is a poison so toxic that Pokémon as large as Wailord will still be suffering three days after it first takes effect.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon lives within a dome made by its own legs. Toxapex monitors its surroundings by sensing the flow of the tide through its spikes.
pokedex_entries.violet: Toxapex gets into fierce battles with Bruxish over areas where warm ocean currents flow, but the odds are always against it.

pokedex_entries.sun: It eats berries and stores their seeds in its beak. When it encounters enemies or prey, it fires off all the seeds in a burst.
pokedex_entries.moon: By bending its beak, it can produce a variety of calls and brand itself a noisy nuisance for its neighbors.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It can bend the tip of its beak to produce over a hundred different cries at will.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.

pokedex_entries.sun: Its long, striking legs aren’t just for show but to be used to kick with skill. In victory, it shows off by kicking the defeated, laughing boisterously.
pokedex_entries.moon: A Pokémon known for the beauty of its well-shaped legs, it sometimes appears as a mascot in advertisements for beauty salons.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: A master of grand and beautiful kicks, it can knock out even kickboxing champions with a single blow.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: A Pokémon with an aggressive personality and a mastery of kicking, it cackles every time it kicks an opponent.
pokedex_entries.sword: This feared Pokémon has long, slender legs and a cruel heart. It shows no mercy as it stomps on its opponents.
pokedex_entries.shield: A kick from the hardened tips of this Pokémon’s legs leaves a wound in the opponent’s body and soul that will never heal.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon is proud and aggressive. However, it is said that a Tsareena will instantly become calm if someone touches the crown on its calyx.
pokedex_entries.violet: This Pokémon launches fierce yet elegant kicks with its long, slender legs. It views Quaquaval as its rival.

pokedex_entries.sun: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.
pokedex_entries.moon: It gushes fire and poisonous gases from its nostrils. Its dung is an explosive substance and can be put to various uses.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It lives in volcanoes and eats sulfur and other minerals. Materials from the food it eats form the basis of its explosive shell.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Its exploding shell poses a real danger but is sensitive to moisture. On rainy days, Turtonator takes silent refuge in caves.
pokedex_entries.sword: Explosive substances coat the shell on its back. Enemies that dare attack it will be blown away by an immense detonation.
pokedex_entries.shield: Eating sulfur in its volcanic habitat is what causes explosive compounds to develop in its shell. Its droppings are also dangerously explosive.

pokedex_entries.sun: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokémon has some hidden special power.
pokedex_entries.moon: Due to the danger that this synthetic Pokémon may go on a rampage, it wears a control mask to restrain its power.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: A Pokémon weapon developed for a specific mission, it went berserk during an experiment, so it was cryogenically frozen.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: There’s danger of its going on a rampage, so its true power is sealed away beneath its control mask.
pokedex_entries.sword: Rumor has it that the theft of top-secret research notes led to a new instance of this Pokémon being created in the Galar region.
pokedex_entries.shield: It was modeled after a mighty Pokémon of myth. The mask placed upon it limits its power in order to keep it under control.

pokedex_entries.sun: It zips around, on sharp lookout for an opening. It concentrates electrical energy within its large jaws and uses it to zap its enemies.
pokedex_entries.moon: It produces electricity via an electrical organ in its abdomen. It overwhelms bird Pokémon with shocking beams of electrical energy.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It has an organ that generates electricity in its abdomen. It concentrates energy in its strong jaws and fires off powerful jolts of electricity.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Vikavolt flusters opponents with acrobatic flying maneuvers. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electric beam attack.
pokedex_entries.sword: It builds up electricity in its abdomen, focuses it through its jaws, and then fires the electricity off in concentrated beams.
pokedex_entries.shield: If it carries a Charjabug to use as a spare battery, a flying Vikavolt can rapidly fire high-powered beams of electricity.

pokedex_entries.sun: This Pokémon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.
pokedex_entries.moon: Its habitat varies from beaches to seabeds. A natural scavenger, it will gleefully chow down on anything edible, no matter how rotten.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It will pick up anything it finds on the ground. Sometimes it finds coins, so Murkrow and Meowth will go after it.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: An astonishingly cowardly Pokémon, Wimpod will whir its legs at high speeds to run away if anything comes near it.
pokedex_entries.sword: It’s nature’s cleaner—it eats anything and everything, including garbage and rotten things. The ground near its nest is always clean.
pokedex_entries.shield: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy’s presence.

pokedex_entries.sun: When it’s in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.
pokedex_entries.moon: It’s awfully weak and notably tasty, so everyone is always out to get it. As it happens, anyone trying to bully it receives a painful lesson.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: They’re weak, so they move in schools. However, they can also often be seen all alone, having strayed from the school.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: When it’s in a jam, its shining eyes attract others of its kind. The light from its eyes is visible almost 25 miles away.
pokedex_entries.sword: Individually, they’re incredibly weak. It’s by gathering up into schools that they’re able to confront opponents.
pokedex_entries.shield: When it senses danger, its eyes tear up. The sparkle of its tears signals other Wishiwashi to gather.

pokedex_entries.sun: One of the mysterious life-forms known as Ultra Beasts. Astonishing electric shocks emanate from its entire body, according to witnesses.
pokedex_entries.moon: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. It raided a power plant, so people think it energizes itself with electricity.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: They’ve been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.

pokedex_entries.sun: With its sharp fangs, it will bite anything. It did not originally live in Alola but was imported from another region.
pokedex_entries.moon: It wanders around in a never-ending search for food. At dusk, it collapses from exhaustion and falls asleep on the spot.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Its stomach takes up most of its long torso. It’s a big eater, so the amount Trainers have to spend on its food is no laughing matter.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Although it will eat anything, it prefers fresh living things, so it marches down streets in search of prey.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Its stomach fills most of its torso. It wanders the same path every day, searching for fresh food.
pokedex_entries.violet: It spends its waking hours searching endlessly for food. When Yungoos is hungry, its ferocity gains a certain edge.

pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack, they’ll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.
pokedex_entries.sword: It runs as fast as lightning strikes, shredding its opponents with its high-voltage claws.
pokedex_entries.shield: Electricity sparks from the pads on its limbs. Wherever Zeraora runs, lightning flashes and thunder echoes.
